Reviews.Title: Surprisingly nice camera - very happy with it.
Reviews.Author: MARTY MCCAFFERTY
Reviews.Content: I use this camera to monitor my cats.  This camera has a very clear picture (640x480) and is better that other camera's I have used.  I use this camera with Firefox at home and from work.  I am surprised how clear and what great frame rate I see, it looks like a live video camera verses the blurry web-cams I am used to seeing.  It even works on my Android phone.I got this camera because it is wireless and supports G, it also supports wired network connection.  You have to connect it wired first to configure it for your home wireless network then you can place it anywhere in your home wireless range.  The only wire you will have is the one for power.This camera is able to pan so I can look around the room to see what the cats are up too.  The night vision IR LEDs are bright so even in a dark room you get a clear picture.  I have recently purchased another one for monitoring my front door and front yard.This camera also has audio so you can hear what is going on near the camera and it also has a speaker so you can send audio back to the camera and speak to a person near the camera.  That feature requires Internet Explorer because it has a ActiveX plug-in to perform Audio functions.  I do not use this feature so I can not comment on it.This camera blinking light on the front while it is on, and may make some audible sounds while panning so it is not designed as a "spy-cam"After showing some co-workers the quality of the picture and panning abilities they also purchased this camera and are also happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Wireless pain to connect; but good for the money.
Reviews.Author: Jeremy C.
Reviews.Content: Edit: Changed from 1 to 3 stars after vender reply.Pros: cheap and better quality camera picture than some of the others in the same price range.Cons: I tried a lot of things, and the wireless just would not work work.  It will scan the network - see the wireless networks, but when i try and switch it to wireless only, it just never shows up on the wireless.  works flawless via Ethernet however - but i bought a "wireless" camera.I will note that the Vendor replied to me in regards to this..."For wireless settings,the channel should be 6,and for wireless security,the encyption mode and authenicate mode should be fixed-single mode(the mode camera can support,such as WPA but not WPA/WPA2),and password should be fixed.(the settings must be confirmed)After router settings,access camera web setting page,search wifi then input password,then press set button,then camera restarts,for F series unplug cable when camera is restarting;for H series unplug both power and cable when camera is restarting then reconnect power."Now, with no security - on channel 6, i have it working.  The quality is decent over wireless.  Bumping my review, but i can't say it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: DE guy "DE guy"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this wireless IP camera from a different vendor at a lower price and was somewhat hesitant because of the configuration difficulties that I had read about in others' postings.  What I found was that the instruction manual, though there were some minor grammatical errors, was perfectly clear and adequately illustrated.  It should enable anyone at all who can follow simple directions in the order presented to have the camera functioning in short order. No special technical skills are required, just follow the directions.  The software tool supplied will give you the specific IP address of your camera, if it's not printed on the bottom tag.  Its web server is built into the camera and, after setup, it's accessed via any browser from any computer anywhere on the planet.  It's controlled from the computer's browser, but, if you want to use the built-in microphone, speaker and video recording functions, you must use Internet Explorer. Be sure to activate the Active X controls in the browser.The camera is plug and play capable for automatic port forwarding, if you need that. I had to do nothing in setup except to select my home network's name from the list and enter my encryption key.Of course, the images are in color unless at night when the infra-red lamps come on and the images are B&W.;  IR range is quite good. You can adjust resolution, frequency, brightness and contrast but not color characteristics.The system requirements listed are in excess of what's really needed to control and use the camera.  I set it up with an advanced PC and then switched to a very old laptop with half the power they said I would need and the results were more than satisfactory.I've seen what appear to be identical cameras of this type marketed by several vendors at very different prices. I would just choose the cheapest.  It cannot be used outside but does have an "outside" setting if you want to aim it through a window.  Focus is manual.

Reviews.Title: NOT an Apexis camera - they're selling EasyN knockoffs
Reviews.Author: Kevin Burtch
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed when I received my shipment, as this was obviously not the camera I ordered.What I received was in totally different packaging (see the photo I uploaded) and the camera's housing was made with a much cheaper process (see the side-by-side comparison photo I uploaded).I figured, maybe they're the same on the inside... NOPE.This camera is much lower quality than the one they advertize. The picture is much grainier and fuzzier, the color saturation at medium light levels is absolutely horrible, and the automatic IR illumination has very few stages... it's essentially either on or off (unlike the real Apexis, which has an impressive progressive illumination). You can clearly see all of this from the two screenshots I uploaded, one from a real Apexis (bought via Amazon from another vendor), the other from this EasyN device.The sad part is, not only is it a different brand, the part number is nothing remotely close to what they list on the product page, it's FS-613A-M136, not APM-J011-WS.Edit: There was only one good thing I can say about this transaction, Amazon's (Prime) shipping was incredibly fast... I received it on Saturday and didn't expect it until Monday.

Reviews.Title: You never know which camera you are going to get
Reviews.Author: S. M. Hanel "Sharon Hansel"
Reviews.Content: I owned 2 Apexis cameras and tried to get 4 more.  I ordered from this place and got EasyN cameras even through at the time they showed Apexis.  Not all that bad since the EasyN have the same features as Apexis, and are compatible with the Apexis Ipod app.Then I tried to get 4 more and this time got Wansniew camers.  These are NOT the same.  They don't have position presets, and the motion is backwards when controlled by the IPod app.  I wish sellers would just say what camera they are selling.  I may end up retuning this batch if I can't find a way to make them more compatible with my current system.

Reviews.Title: Great Hardware, Missing Software
Reviews.Author: Sean P. Devoy "SPD"
Reviews.Content: The unit itself is easy to install and view through a web browser.The documentation explains the use of the "Super-Client" which is not on the CD or on their web site download of the CD.  However, look for something like "Japan version of Super-Client" in the downloads section of their website.  That version includes English!Super-Client is very nice, if you get past the poor language translation in the menus and commands.I am amazed at the IR/Night Vision capabilities, especially inside.I would purchase this unit again if I needed another camera.SPD.

Reviews.Title: Not selling the brand & model of camera listed here...
Reviews.Author: RC
Reviews.Content: Because of other reviewers reporting they got a different brand of camera, I decided to contact several of the sellers, directly, and here are their responses.BetterStuff LowerPrice: "We are really sorry, but please understand that it's an Easyn brand camera, not Apexis."Bestgoodlikewater:  Indicated they sell EasyN or TCL cameras.  Clarifying:  "Yes,but TCL is batter than  Apexis."Dealheroes:  "Although they are not brand as 'Apexis', our products has high quality."E-Bundle:  No response.  Actually selling EasyN cameras, per Kevin Burtch.eRightech:  No response.Geeks:  Selling legitimate Apexis cameras.LikeWay:  "you can believe that you inquiring  camera was by Apexis .if you have the intention  to  order this products please contact  us ."SunMall:  No response.Tidbits and Pieces:  No response.If you've got any info to add, feel free to write a comment.I guess you might as well go buy the cheaper EasyN camera from the lower-priced product page:$37 EasyN FS-613B-M166 Wireless Pan/Tilt IP Camera with 2-Way Audio

Reviews.Title: Not working, poorly written instructions, no support.
Reviews.Author: Luke Rein
Reviews.Content: The camera worked great at first but stopped in a couple of days. Now I can't use it wirelessly or access it over the network. Resetting and reinstalling would not fix the problem. The instructions are not very helpful and I contacted the company for help and they did not respond. Spend another $20 and get a camera from someone who actually offers support for their product.

Reviews.Title: Instructions on how to setup camera
Reviews.Author: Lifted Jeep
Reviews.Content: I am going to go through the fastest way to set up this camera for use on your wireless network. Heck with this you don't even need the CD. You can use a computer, smartphone or tablet to set it up.1. Plug the provided network cable into the camera and into your router.2. Find the sticker on the box that shows the username and IP address.3. On any computer connected to your router open the browser and type in the IP you found, i.e. "192.168.1.126:81"4. It will ask for a login. Mine was username:"admin" and had no password so just press enter.5. Now you will have 4 "sign in" links, click the one under "server push mode"6. The video of your camera should appear. Ignore that right now, click the gear looking icon at the bottom to get to the settings.7. Click on "Wireless Lan settings".8. Click Scan and select your router and fill in the passcode.9. Click set and your set.10. Unplug your camera and move it wherever you want now.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, much easier than other reviewers imply
Reviews.Author: tscales
Reviews.Content: We've owned this camera for quite some time and use it to monitor our child's room.  We're about to add two more cameras and we'll go with what works -- this camera.Not sure why so many others have had problems.  You don't need a CD at all. You can just type the IP address of the camera into your web browser. You do get more features with Internet Explorer, which I can live with.You do have to set it up using a wired connection first. Once you do, you can switch to wireless.  I was surprised that one reviewer was confused that the LAN connection and the Wireless connection had different MAC addresses.  Of course they do. Every LAN connectable device has a unique MAC address.  Every laptop has one for the LAN port and one for the wireless port.I am pretty technical, but I found the camera quite easy.  Five stars.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Technical Support, NO Replacement
Reviews.Author: A. Malaspina "Ace Bugner"
Reviews.Content: These cams actually do the job for the price, but, if they break, forget about using their technical support or getting a replacement. NO US Technical support and they will not honor the warranty. I bought a few of those for my office and 2 of them stopped working. After several emails to EasyN tech support (very hard to understand what they write), they stopped responding me after they sent me a bunch of completely useless instructions to fix the problem. I got rid of the cams and got cams from a manufacture that I know for a fact they have a working US support. $120 straight into the garbage.

Reviews.Title: Not by Apexis
Reviews.Author: edkelly
Reviews.Content: The camera received was from EasyN and EasyN does not even list it in their current products. The EasyN camera was listed for less money and worse reviews. The camera does not have  the alarm output as the similar cameras listed on the Apexis site. The camera web interface server software is poor. Was told by Amazon that Apexis makes cameras sold under different brands. If it is Advertised as by Apexis, it should be an Apexis camera!!

Reviews.Title: Does not need Windows to set it up
Reviews.Author: W. Wang "Wayne"
Reviews.Content: You don't need Windows to set it up.  It comes with factory setting IP is 192.168.0.178, the http port is 80, the username is admin, the password is 123456.  Just set your ip to be 192.168.0.177, subnet mask 255.255.255.0 and gateway 192.168.0.178, then access [...] from your browser.  More details are in:[...]

Reviews.Title: Not for the faint of heart
Reviews.Author: T. Guthrie
Reviews.Content: I went through quite a few steps trying to get this camera to function correctly and ended up not being able to at the very end. Here's a list of the issues I ran into.1. The manual describes a management software program that is supposed to be installed from the provided cd. The program did not exist on the cd so after emailing the seller I received a link to be able to download the program and the download worked.2. The manual stated I would have a registration code either on the cd itself or at the end of the manual for the management software program. Wasn't in either location so another email to the seller got me a response with a registration code.3. Wireless connection would not work and I am quite familiar with getting devices connected to my wireless network. After trying many things I realized that the MAC address supplied by the camera was not the same for both the lan connection and the wireless connection. Since I have my wireless locked down to only allowing the MAC addresses that I specify this was a significant issue and the seller was unable to provide me details on how to determine the actual wireless MAC address of the camera.4. Returned the camera and am currently waiting for a refund.As far as the camera functionality (when connected to the lan) it had a decent picture and a substantial range of motion. If I was planning on having this as an internal camera connected to the network I would have been willing to keep it for that function once I received all the software necessary to run it properly.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for technically inclined..
Reviews.Author: David Walker
Reviews.Content: The camera works as advertised.  The video quality is excellent and has not lost a connection once it was setup.  The review may change if the camera fails in the first few months otherwise I am very happy with the results.

Reviews.Title: Chinese knock off camera
Reviews.Author: 619rcr
Reviews.Content: Chinese knock off camera, not Apexis brand as advertised.  Instructions poorly translated into english and confusing.  Figured out myself by trial and error method.  Wired mode default config, wireless difficult to setup at best.  220 to 110 volt power adapter was missing, had to scavenge from my (japanese) dvd player.  Camera works ok after setup complete.

Reviews.Title: Excellent I P Camera for the $
Reviews.Author: cyber
Reviews.Content: I already had a Foscam IP Camera. So I bought this one for much less. The setup is exactly the same.  I even used the previous Foscam software to add this IP Camera.  Works the same. Pictures quality is the same.  Only difference is I can turn off the IR lights on the Foscam, this camera's IR lights are always on.  Motion detection adjusts better with this camera than the Foscam. I can also access this camera with my Foscam iPhone/iPad app. I use Surveilence Pro for Foscam.  If you are going to set any I P camera up you need to know how to port forward your router. It's not difficult. YouTube has How-to-videos.  I already knew how to that procedure. It a great cheap way to have a remote monitor at home or office. Mine does a great job and is set to record any break-in and immediately email my iPhone.

Reviews.Title: Lost in translation
Reviews.Author: hugh-manoid
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive.Relatively simple WIRED connection and setup.It takes several attempts to scan wireless networks before any show up using the supplied software to access the settings in the camera.  I/R leds have a faint reddish tinge when on. Thankfully, the front green LED can be turned off.How  much would it cost to have an english speaking person proofread before publishing ?  It seems the more technical things get, the more ambiguous the documentation gets.  Also it would be nice to have the MAC addresseS (yes two)printed on the bottom or listed where one can acess it once connected.I use MAC address filtering on my router to make my network more secure.This has to be off temporarily to simplify finding the WIFI MAC address.Luckily, my router lists the MAC and IP adresses of wireless candidates.I started with the direct connect to router in order to set the WIFI.Eventually, I was able to ping the default IP address wirelessly.But alas, no video.  I set the camera back to default and it reverted to slightly different settings than it shipped with.  Default was DHCP enabled and port 80.It arrived set for fixed IP 192.168.1.216  port 81.  After more twiddling, and moving closer to the router, I have video using 192.168.1.216 and port 80.I eventually hope to connect from the outside world (internet) to this thing and after that, link it to my Synology NAS.  Wish me luck.---------------Update (a few days later)Diddled with DDNS, port forwarding, registering my ip address and other minutae.Now I can see the video feed remotely (internet vs intranet).  Also added the camera to a Synology NAS with Surveillance Station software but haven't been able to get to the NAS remotely.To disable the IR leds that are soldered drirectly to the PCB,Void the warranty by adding a parallel resistor across the photo resistorMaybe 10k or so.  The photo resistor reads about 80k ohm dark and 15k ohm or less when  light.  Requires basic electronics and soldering skills.

Reviews.Title: crappy cheap design
Reviews.Author: Vince A. Tran "FoundGoodDeals dot com"
Reviews.Content: I would stay away from such crappy copycat product with an unknown brand, it does have nice package and a website for contact but the company located in China [...]Everything worked at initial setup like they showed in the manual, although I had a hard time connect the IPcam with wireless.  But after a couple of days running, the camera just went dead. I could not even reset it.  I'm returning it as I wrote this

Reviews.Title: So near and yet so far
Reviews.Author: Johnny "BarJohn"
Reviews.Content: In spite of others' warnings about the documentation, I ordered this.  I do web stuff for a living, so I thought I could overcome the obstacles.I'm now into my fourth hour of trying to make things work, and I'm making progress.  But the installation CD is virtually non-functional (It's impossible, for example, to install the client that is supposed to let your record.)On the manufacturer's web site (Hong Kong - no user support telephone number) I found a client to download, and after spending an hour fiddling with it, I got it to talk to my camera.  But then it turns out that the software is a trial version, and the permanent version is another $50 or so.As for the 'so near' part of the title: this seems to be a really, really nice camera for the money. But unless I can find a way to get it to perform as advertised without spending another $50, back it goes.And unless, you're really comfortable messing with routers and operating systems and the internet, do not buy it:  it's a real shame that they put all the effort into lots of good pieces but didn't tie them together for the average user.

Reviews.Title: Great Price, Still works a year later
Reviews.Author: Brady
Reviews.Content: Its a good pan-tilt camera for the price. It has audio and is smooth.I accidentally updated it recently with an update for FOSCAM cameras, because all of my other cameras are FOSCAM. I just forgot that this was not a FOSCAM. I no longer can access the camera's GUI interface. It still feeds video and audio though. So, I am not sure what will happen when a power failure happens.I think it is as good as the FOSCAM pan-tilt cameras released in 2012 an 2013.

Reviews.Title: What's my model number?
Reviews.Author: Clifford Knowles
Reviews.Content: Not sure what model camera actually is.  No in at ructions.  Camera keeps changing IP address and I cannot view outsider my home network.

Reviews.Title: Just Okay
Reviews.Author: Queen Goldie
Reviews.Content: They work fine except still can't record and replay. Owner had  no knowledge of helping with this issue. Still would like to correct this issue.

Reviews.Title: Worth $45, but not a miracle
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: 5 stars because it's just what I expected: A cheap 320x240 pan/tilt wireless camera.  It helps me keep an eye on things when I'm out & about, definitely worth the $45.The video quality is as rough as you see in the reviews-enough to see what's going on, but not enough to read test or identify a face.For the people having configuration troubles: you setup the camera on a wired connection, then move it to a wireless network.  Easy-peasy-lemon-squeezy.

Reviews.Title: Not the Apexis name on what I received
Reviews.Author: Pierre
Reviews.Content: Although it works great and is a bargain at this price, it is not as described, it is a Chinese knockoff, but what the hay it works good and was easy to configure for me not I have 35 years in IT. Good luck to a novice on configuring your router.

Reviews.Title: Easy to setup and sharp images
Reviews.Author: cleiton
Reviews.Content: it does work as it promisses to be.  even the direction are too simple it's very friendly user so over the web you can find out some more instructions, if needed.

Reviews.Title: failed
Reviews.Author: david bellerose "techman"
Reviews.Content: unit failed after a few hours stopped beeing able to scan unit wireless stopped working sent unit back same day

Reviews.Title: Does weird stuff on the network.
Reviews.Author: Pascual Trujillo
Reviews.Content: When observing the communication of this device on the network, it appears to attempt to make connections to an unknown addresses out on the Internet.  Also causes my router to lock occasionally .  I will play around with the options to see if I can filter odd communication. In the mean time, I keep it on an isolated network.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, once I got it working.
Reviews.Author: Randy
Reviews.Content: The setup instructions leave a lot to be desired. Out of frustration, I kept giving up, then trying again days later. EasyN support was there and did try to help. They looked at screen shots of settings that they requested me to send them. Their reply was that all of the settings were correct, that camera should be working. In the end, they were absolutely correct. I could access and control the camera from within my household wifi network but could not do so from the internet. I finally found the problem involved my VOIP telephone adapter. I had the output of my cable modem connected to the input of the VOIP adapter, the VOIP output then went to my wireless router. All of the above connections refer to the Ethernet cables. I had the port forwarding settings correctly set in the router, however, the VOIP adapter was not passing the port access requests through. I changed the hookup as follows: cable modem output directly to router input, VOIP adapter input moved to empty ethernet output on router, VOIP adapter output not used. BINGO!, full internet access to camera achieved. My particular issue cannot be blamed on the camera or EasyN.The camera has a very good picture, even in low light, thanks to it's IR led ring. The camera also responded very well to movement commands. Preset positions can be set and accessed. Other features are available and work okay. I would buy this camera again if I had it to do over.The VOIP/telephone also functions as before.

Reviews.Title: Very good for the price
Reviews.Author: yanming peng
Reviews.Content: Pro: Wireless, night vision and Pan & Tilt as well as built-in server for different browsersCon: Wireless setup is a little difficult with little document.

Reviews.Title: Iffy hosting for this
Reviews.Author: jfoster38122
Reviews.Content: Sometimes I can log on to the website and sometimes I can'tI am looking for a different website to host the cam for me.The instructions are horrible that come with it

Reviews.Title: Slight Issues
Reviews.Author: D. Shrock "The glass is half full"
Reviews.Content: I have not been able to get the record to work with the browser. If that wasn't the case I would give it 4 stars. I think it will suit most needs for a low price camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Trek65
Reviews.Content: Just received it today, installation using ethernet cable is easier than a router, the quality of the video in the LAN area is pretty good, better if you use firefox browser. For the price I think is an excellent product if you want to keep an eye on your pet or if your alarm goes off and want to see whats going on before calling the police.I tried to connect it wireless first, but could not find the device, it should be easier after is been set up with a cable.

Reviews.Title: Pain in the rear setup but work pretty well
Reviews.Author: A.J.
Reviews.Content: So, I bought these despite the reviews and must say I am fairly satisfied. But there are a couple things I don't like.First, the wireless doesn't work particularly well. I have them hardwired for network connection which isn't ideal for a WIRELESS camera but eh, it works.Second, the setup directions were not clear. I hardwired both cameras to my network and still couldn't find them and couldn't figure out why. Granted, my network uses the 10.0.0.0/24 addressing scheme instead of the 192.168.0.0/24 or 192.168.1.0/24 scheme but that doesn't matter. So, after some thought, I hardwired my computer to my network (my 802.3 and 802.11 networks use the same addressing scheme and have all the same permissions and access) and then it found the cameras and I was able to statically set the IP addresses to what I wanted them to be. After that, everything seems to work. I love that you can control the pan, tilt and such remotely. Overall, I give it a 3 because of the pain to setup and the fact they will sometimes kick out their connection but overall a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Wireless Network camera
Reviews.Author: JC
Reviews.Content: The camera is a good value for the money. The instruction are a bit limited for a novice but with diligence it can be set up. Colors aren't very bright almost looks like infrared is always on making picture a bit washed out. All said it works and it was affordable. I bought 2.All in all a fair deal

Reviews.Title: Not a wireless device!
Reviews.Author: Odies Fan
Reviews.Content: Instructions are almost unintelligable.  Not a wireless device, it requires wired connection to router. Without that it isn't even a good boat anchor.

Reviews.Title: Perfect baby monitor.
Reviews.Author: D. Lusica
Reviews.Content: Picked this up yesterday from a local shop. Paid a few bucks more than from the vine because I wanted to be able to return just in case. Some of the prior reviews made me hesitant to buy this.I'm glad that I made the purchase because it does exactly what I need it to do. It's function in our home is a day/night baby monitor and it's great picture quality. It was also easy to set up - attach the antenna, plug in the power, plug in the network cable, run the software and move to the desired location. Done! Once accomplished, up to 9 devices can view, tilt, and pan the camera remotely.The camera gives a great picture and it automatically adjusts to 'night vision' in low and no light conditions. A prior review stated that there is a blinking light on the camera when active. I painted over this light with nail polish before I discovered you can disable this status light in the settings.I'm considering buying a second and third unit for the home.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera -- Awful Instructions
Reviews.Author: John L. Gerlaugh
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these cameras for the same reason as the previous reviewer did -- to monitor the activity of my cats, one or both of whom are making undesirable deposits behind the couch.  I wanted a low-light motion-detection camera that would take a video of what's happening, then store a recording of the "activity" to my computer's hard drive, and hopefully notify me that a recording had been made.  Interpreting the Chinese-written-in-English users manual was comical but very frustrating, and I got as far as being able to see the camera's activity in a browser window on my network, but that was it -- could not for the life of me figure out how to do anything more complicated than that, and I'm not a computer novice.  I sent an e-mail to customer support (in China) -- it was never answered.  Their website is less than useless for help.  If you just want to sit at your computer and monitor activity in another room in real time, it's easy to do with this one, but don't expect to easily go further than that to make the camera really useful when you're not around.

Reviews.Title: Really good for the price.. but need to be a bit geek
Reviews.Author: bioranieri
Reviews.Content: Really good for the price.. but need to be a bit geek to configure. Not friendly. I wouldn't recommend for "normal IT users".

Reviews.Title: Poor instructions and oicture quality quality
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: This item is difficult to set up. The instructions are very poor. The software is poor. The pictures are fuzzy even with adjustments. I wouldnt recommend this item for novices.

Reviews.Title: NOT Wireless
Reviews.Author: The Llama Guy "It's all for the llamas."
Reviews.Content: I have purchased these cameras before from different vendors and they have been great.However, in this case the cameras I received were NOT wireless.  The were identical in every way to the other cameras I had previously purchased but these had no antenna and no wireless configuration.Even the boxes said they were wireless but the camera in the box was not.Unfortunately for me, my return period expired before I went to install them so now I am stuck with these useless cameras.

ProductInfo.Features:
Wireless Infrared Motion Night Vision Network Color Camera General Features: Color: Black
Powerful, high-speed video protocol processor Picture total: 300K pixels Ten (10) IR LEDs
MJPEG video compression Supports wireless network 802.11b/g
High sensitivity 1.4" color CMOS sensor Resolution: 640 x 480 (VGA), 320 x 240 (QVGA)
Video Frame Rate: 30 fps (QVGA), 30 fps (VGA)
ProductInfo.Name: Wireless Infrared Motion Night Vision Network Color Camera w/Pan & Tilt Control, Microphone
